skill.name: clinpgx-database
skill.description: Access ClinPGx pharmacogenomics data (successor to PharmGKB). Query gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, allele functions, for precision medicine and genotype-guided dosing decisions.
skill.summary: Access ClinPGx pharmacogenomics data (successor to PharmGKB). Query gene-drug interactions, CPIC gui...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 366 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a legitimate pharmacogenomics database API client. The static analyzer misidentified Markdown code fences as shell backticks, gene function descriptions as cryptographic algorithms, and clinical tool references as system reconnaissance. Network calls are to a public API (api.clinpgx.org), file writes are for caching API results, and there is no malicious code present.

content.value_statement: Access comprehensive clinical pharmacogenomics information including gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, and allele function data. Query genetic variants affecting medication response for precision medicine applications.
actual_capabilities: Query gene-drug pairs for pharmacogenomic interactions and clinical annotations
Retrieve CPIC clinical guidelines for evidence-based prescribing recommendations
Access allele function, population frequency, and phenotype data for pharmacogenes
Get drug label information with pharmacogenomic content from FDA and other regulatory sources
limitations: Requires internet access to query the ClinPGx API (no local database included)
Rate limited to 2 requests per second - bulk queries need proper delay implementation
Does not provide clinical decision-making - information is for reference only
Allele coverage depends on ClinPGx database completeness

use_cases.title: Medication Safety Review
use_cases.description: Review patient medications against genotype data to identify drug-gene interactions requiring dose adjustments.

use_cases.title: Population Frequency Analysis
use_cases.description: Query allele frequencies across populations to study pharmacogenomic variation in different ethnic groups.

use_cases.title: Clinical Decision Support
use_cases.description: Build pharmacogenomic decision support tools using CPIC guideline data and gene-drug annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Gene-Drug Interactions
prompt_templates.scenario: Finding drug interactions for a gene
prompt_templates.prompt: Query ClinPGx for all drugs affected by the CYP2D6 gene and their CPIC recommendation levels.

prompt_templates.title: CPIC Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the CPIC guideline for CYP2C19 and clopidogrel, including phenotype-based dosing recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Allele Frequencies
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the population frequencies for CYP2D6*4 allele in European, African, and East Asian populations?

prompt_templates.title: Drug Label Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find FDA drug labels for warfarin that mention pharmacogenomic testing requirements.

output_examples.input: Query ClinPGx for CYP2D6 and codeine gene-drug pair information
output: Clinical Annotation: Poor metabolizers have reduced conversion of codeine to morphine, resulting in decreased analgesic effect

best_practices: Implement 0.5 second delays between requests to respect the 2 requests per second rate limit
Cache frequently accessed data locally to reduce API calls and improve performance
Always verify evidence levels (1A, 1B, 2A, etc.) before applying findings in clinical contexts
anti_patterns: Making rapid sequential requests without delays - will trigger rate limiting (HTTP 429)
Using ClinPGx data for automated clinical decisions without human review
Assuming complete allele coverage - not all clinically relevant alleles are in every assay

faq.question: What is ClinPGx?
faq.answer: ClinPGx is a clinical pharmacogenomics database that consolidates data from PharmGKB, CPIC, and PharmCAT. It provides curated information on how genetic variants affect medication response.

faq.question: Is authentication required?
faq.answer: No authentication is required for basic API access. The ClinPGx API is publicly accessible with rate limiting.

faq.question: What genes are covered?
faq.answer: Key pharmacogenes include CYP450 enzymes (CYP2D6, CYP2C19, CYP2C9), transporters (SLCO1B1), and metabolism genes (TPMT, DPYD, UGT1A1).

faq.question: What are CPIC guidelines?
faq.answer:: CPIC (Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium) provides evidence-based clinical practice guidelines for using pharmacogenomic data in prescribing.

faq.question: How often is data updated?
faq.answer: ClinPGx continuously updates with new evidence and guidelines. CPIC guidelines are updated as new evidence emerges.

faq.question: Can this be used for clinical decisions?
faq.answer: Information is for reference only. Clinical decisions should involve qualified healthcare professionals and consider complete patient context.
